result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Jospeh Forrest

records.addlTxt: 8:09 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jason Jospeh Forrest in court, in custody for unrelated matter.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Jason Jospeh Forrest.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file.  Atty Dobbe states DE is still requesting a trial.  Court states FPT date is the cutoff for negotiations.  State and Defense to file requested instructions, Witness Lists and MIL's by 11/18/22.  Atty Dobbe asks the Court to review continuance request filed by the State.  At this time Court is keeping the JT on as is.  Adjourned at 8:13 AM. bph

3:55 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Aaron Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court w/Jason Joseph Forrest in court, in custody.  S/T Deputy Benjamin Trebian. SCSO; direct by Atty Damrau. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Dobbe. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Damrau notes Information will mirror the Complaint. Atty Dobbe states DE would like to come back for the ARGN. Bond continues is form and amount. Adjourned:  4:12 pm
Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:00 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason Joseph Forrest in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe not in court. Set for PH. Court notes Atty Dobbe's adjournment request that was sent to SRN, rather than TCH for consideration. Court finds good cause to reschedule the PH. DE is on probation hold. JA will reach out to Atty Dobbe and DA's office to reset the matter. Officer was present to testify, prefers PH after 3:30 pm. Adjourned: 1:06  pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
